contentrichtext.text: Nine ships of the [[Royal Navy]] have been named HMS ''Meteor'' after the [[meteor]], a [[outer space|space]] object. *[[HMS Meteor (1797)|HMS ''Meteor'']] was a 12-gun [[gunboat|gunvessel]], previously in civilian service as ''Lady Cathcart''. She was purchased in 1797 and initially named ''Gunboat No. 34''. She was sold in 1802. *[[HMS Meteor (1803)|HMS ''Meteor'']] was an 8-gun [[bomb vessel]], previously in civilian service as ''Sarah Ann''. She was purchased in 1803 and sold in 1811. *[[HMS Starr (1805)|HMS ''Meteor'']] was an 18-gun [[sloop-of-war|sloop]] launched in 1805 as [[HMS Starr (1805)|HMS ''Starr'']]. She was rebuilt as a bomb vessel in 1812 and was renamed HMS ''Meteor''. She was sold in 1816. *[[HMS Meteor (1823)|HMS ''Meteor'']] was an 8-gun bomb vessel launched in 1823. She became a [[survey ship]] in 1832 and was renamed HMS ''Beacon''. She was sold in 1846. *[[HMS Meteor (1824)|HMS ''Meteor'']] was a wooden paddle vessel launched in 1824 and broken up in 1849. *[[HMS Meteor (1839)|HMS ''Meteor'']] was a river gunboat launched in 1839. Her fate is unknown. *[[HMS Meteor (1855)|HMS ''Meteor'']] was an [[Aetna class ironclad floating battery|''Aetna''-class ironclad floating battery]] launched in 1855 and broken up in 1861. *[[HMS Meteor (1914)|HMS ''Meteor'']] was an [[Thornycroft M class destroyer|M-class]] [[destroyer]] launched in 1914 and sold in 1921. *[[HMS Meteor (G74)|HMS ''Meteor'']] was an [[L and M class destroyer|M-class]] destroyer launched in 1941. She was handed over to the [[Turkish Navy]] in 1959 and renamed ''Piyale Pasha''. She was on their navy lists until 1979. ==See also== *{{HMS|Meteorite}} ==References== *{{Colledge}} {{Shipindex}} {{Italic title prefixed|3}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Meteor, Hms}} [[Category:Royal Navy ship names]]
